titleStmt.title: B. Martin et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7591

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky --

Your petitioners would respectfully represent to your excellency that Daniel Taylor is now confined in the Louisville Jail charged with horse stealing, is a youth about 18 years of age, and as we believe was overpersuaded by an older and more crafty man to engage in the crime of horse stealing, We have known the young man Taylor & his family and know that the young man's deportment was proper upto the time of his being enegaged in the crime for which he is now under arrest -- and we feel safe in representing to your excellency that this young man presents an instance in which executive clemency could be very properly exercised -- & to this end we pray that the said Taylor may be pardoned by your excellency -- as in duty bound &c --

B Martin
Allen Holbrook
Jas; Taylor
William Martin
James R Cobb
Speed Martin
W. P. Estes

G. W. Thornbury
